title: Cert III in Telecommunications Technology
description: The Certificate III in Telecommunications Technology is designed for telecommunications technology operators involved in installation, fault-finding, and testing of telecommunications systems and equipment.
qualificationDescription: Prepares individuals to assess installation needs, perform installations, and troubleshoot networks across various telecommunications environments.

coreUnits.title: Use electrical skills when working with telecommunications networks
Determine and apply technologies within a telecommunications system
Locate, identify and rectify telecommunications network faults
Follow work health and safety and environmental policy and procedures
Provide customer service to telecommunications customers

electiveUnits.title: Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Open Rule
Install, test and terminate optical fibre cable on customer premises
Install, terminate and certify structured cabling installation

learningOutcomes: Provide customer service and technical support.
deliveryMode: Hands-on training at the workplace or training facility.

skillTree.description: Essential training for working safely and effectively with customer premises cabling installations.

outcomes.title: Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Restricted Rule
